# myCAF Proportion Analysis in PDAC Spatial Transcriptomics

## Overview
R scripts for analyzing and visualizing myCAF proportions across different compositional clusters in PDAC spatial transcriptomics data, comparing treated and untreated conditions.

## Dependencies
```R
library(ggplot2)
library(cowplot)
library(viridis)
library(gridExtra)
library(dplyr)
library(Seurat)

Analysis Workflow
1. Data Preparation
RCopy# Extract RCTD data for myCAFs
rctd_data <- GetAssayData(pdac, slot = "data", assay = "rctd_tier2")
myCAF_data <- rctd_data["myCAF",]

# Create data frame
myCAF_df <- data.frame(
  spot = names(myCAF_data),
  myCAF_prop = as.numeric(myCAF_data)
)
2. Generate Statistics
RCopymyCAF_stats <- myCAF_df %>%
  group_by(CompositionCluster_CC, treated) %>%
  summarise(
    mean = mean(myCAF_prop),
    se = sd(myCAF_prop)/sqrt(n()),
    n = n()
  )
3. Visualization
The script generates multiple plots:

Overall proportion bar plot
Treatment comparison bar plots
Distribution box plots
Violin plots

4. Output
RCopypdf("myCAF_analysis_plots.pdf", width = 12, height = 15)
grid.arrange(p1, p2, p3, p4, ncol = 1)
dev.off()
Results

PDF file containing four visualization panels
Consistent cluster ordering: CC10 → CC07 → CC03 → CC01 → CC06 → CC08 → CC09 → CC05
Color scheme:

Untreated: #FF69B4
Treated: #4169E1



Notes

Error bars represent standard error of the mean
Outliers included in violin plots but hidden in box plots
Consistent cluster ordering reflects spatial trajectory
